entry.title: Bitcoin HODLer Selling Exhausts, Supply Now Up By $8 Billion
entry.summary:
On-chain data shows that long-term Bitcoin holders have reversed their trend recently, as their supply has absorbed $8 billion worth of tokens.
Bitcoin HODLers Have Gone Back To Net Accumulation
As explained by CryptoQuant author Axel Adler Jr in a post on X, the long-term holders have been increasing their supply recently. The “long-term holders” (LTHs) here refer to the Bitcoin investors who have held onto their coins for more than 155 days.
These holders make up one of the two main divisions of the BTC market based on holding time, with the other cohort being known as the “short-term holders” (STHs).
Statistically, the longer an investor holds onto their coins, the less likely they become to sell, so the LTHs, who tend to hold for long periods, represent the stubborn side of t…

entry.title: Bitcoin Whales Scoop 358,000 BTC As USDT Liquidity Spikes: Are Bulls Ready To Rumble?
entry.summary:
Bitcoin is bearish at press time, fading last week’s strong gains. Even though buyers expect prices to recover and break above $69,000, bears have been unyielding, even piercing the upper range of the current consolidation.
At spot rates, Bitcoin is down 6% from last week’s highs and roughly 12% from all-time highs. Contracting prices also mean lower lows from all-time highs, a bearish signal.
Bitcoin Whales Ramping Up Purchase
Despite this confluence of bearish signals, there are hints that buyers are accumulating at spot rates. As prices breach $66,000, the primary support, on-chain data shared by Ki Young Ju on X, points to strength, at least looking at whale behavior.
Though prices might be inching lower, Ju, the CEO of CryptoQuant, notes that whales have been aggressively bu…

entry.title: Bankrupt BlockFi Aims to Return “100% of Eligible Claims” amid Recovery from FTX
entry.summary: The bankruptcy estate of the now-collapsed crypto lending platform BlockFi announced yesterday (Thursday) its plans to return “100 percent” of the distressed clients’ claims. However, it will calculate the value of the claims based on the date of the bankruptcy and not the current crypto market value. Recovery of Funds from FTX The return of the claim in its entirety became possible as the bankruptcy administrator of the bankrupt BlockFi “successfully sold… outstanding claims against FTX for an amount in excess of the face value of the claims.” “While these recoveries cannot undo the impact of the platform pause, efficiently distributing 100% of the dollarised value of allowed claims to eligible clients in the near future is an extraordinarily positive outcome,” the announcement noted. Blo…

entry.title: Spot Ethereum ETFs Day 2 Volume Surpasses Experts’ Expectations
entry.summary:
This week, spot Ethereum ETFs (Exchange-Traded Funds) were officially approved and launched, filling the crypto community with excitement about the latest industry milestone. The ETH-based investment products saw an impressive first day, reaching over $1 billion in volume. Following its second day live, some experts shared that the ETFs’ day two volume was higher than expected.
Spot Ethereum ETFs Surpass Expectations
On Monday, the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) gave the final nod to spot Ethereum ETFs, setting the launch date to Tuesday, July 23. Before the launch, Industry figures and experts debated the expectations for the ETH ETFs compared to their Bitcoin (BTC) counterparts.
Many considered that the Ethereum-based products would only do about 20%-30% of Bitcoin E…

entry.title: MicroBT Unveils New WhatsMiner M6XS+ Series at Bitcoin 2024 Conference
entry.summary: MicroBT, a leading innovator in the Bitcoin mining industry, unveiled its latest WhatsMiner M6XS+ series during the Bitcoin 2024 conference in Nashville, TN. The new series, featuring air-cooling, hydro-cooling, and immersion-cooling models, represents a leap forward in renewable mining technology. Dr. Zuoxing Yang, founder and CEO of MicroBT, highlighted these advancements in his keynote address, emphasizing the company's commitment to sustainable and efficient mining practices. Renewable mining, according to Dr. Yang, is the future of the industry, with solar mining poised to be at the forefront. He predicted that by 2026, the electricity cost for solar power mining could drop to approximately 4 cents USD per kWh, saying it would eliminate the primary impediment to the solar power mining…

entry.title: Pro-XRP Lawyer And Senate Candidate John Deaton Reveals 80% Of Net Worth In Bitcoin
entry.summary:
Pro-XRP and crypto attorney John E. Deaton, who won the Republican nomination for Senate in Massachusetts, has emerged as one of the largest crypto holders in the political space ahead of the election, with significant holdings in the largest digital assets on the market.
XRP Defender John E. Deaton’s Crypto Holdings Exposed

entry.title: Dogecoin On The Verge Of First Golden Cross In 4 Years, What Happens Next?
entry.summary:
The Dogecoin (DOGE) outlook is currently bullish, as technical indicators suggest that a golden cross is set to appear on the meme coin’s chart. Based on history, such development could mark the beginning of a massive rally for DOGE.
Dogecoin On The Verge Of A Golden Cross
Crypto analyst Kevin (formerly OG Yomi) mentioned in an X (formerly Twitter) post that Dogecoin is two to three green weeks away from seeing its first weekly golden cross in four years. The analyst added that DOGE enjoyed a 6-month price rally and price gain of 18,000% the last time the meme coin saw a weekly golden cross.
A golden cross occurs when the 50-day moving average (MA) rises above the 200-day MA. This technical indicator is considered a bullish signal as it usually indicates a strong bull market. A…

entry.title: Coinbase UK Unit Faces $4.5 Million Fine For Violating Financial Crime Conditions
entry.summary:
The Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) has slapped the UK subsidiary of Coinbase – CB Payments Limited – with a $4.5 million penalty for breaking a voluntary agreement meant to stop high-risk customers from being onboarded. The FCA brought to light serious problems with the control systems at CBPL.
Coinbase Crossed The Line
CBPL signed a voluntary agreement with the FCA in October 2020 to limit the onboarding of fresh clients judged “high-risk” by the regulator. This agreement was intended to reduce possible criminal activity on the CBPL platform, therefore preserving market integrity and reducing money laundering concerns.
Notwithstanding these protections, the FCA found that CBPL had clearly violated the agreement by onboarding and servicing 13,416 high-risk clients. Joint executi…

entry.title: Bitcoin As A Reliable Strategic Reserve Asset Faces Criticism from Todd Phillips
entry.summary:
Lately, the discussions regarding Bitcoin as a reliable strategic reserve asset have garnered significant interest within the entire cryptocurrency industry due to its potential to serve as a hedge against inflation and economic stability. Even though most people see this as a notable idea, some believe BTC is an unreliable choice for a federal reserve asset.
Bitcoin Latter Is An Input Into Real-World Goods And Services
As the topic heats up, Todd Phillips, a popular banking and administrative lawyer, has voiced his strong criticism toward Bitcoin’s potential as a reserve asset. The lawyer’s objections come in light of United States Senator Cynthia Lummis’ efforts to establish BTC as a mainstream financial asset.
According to a recent report from Fox Business, Lummis is preparing …

Craig Wright now under threat of perjury & forgery. FTX & CFTC in $12.7bn settlement. WLD up 40% after delaying unlock schedule. Helio announces instant crypto fiat commerce. Phantom pauses cross-chain swaps amid exploit.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 159 - MEMECOINS GO MAD!
entry.summary: BTC ETF Inflows: +$301m. BTC dips from $65k as $6bn moves from Mt. Gox. Coinbase & MicroStrategy surge with BTC. Genesis sells another $38m BTC. ETH ETF timeline delayed until July 23rd. Trump chooses crypto friendly Vance as VP. Old clip shows Vance bashing Gensler on crypto. Bitcoin is good during debasement: Larry Fink. Michael Dell calls Fink video ‘fascinating’. Fear & Greed index shifts to Greed. Tether mints $1bn USDT on Tron. Stripe expands crypto integration to the EU.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 158 - A WILD WEEKEND FOR BITCOIN
entry.summary: Trump response optimism takes BTC to $63K. Bitcoin whales accumulate most since April 2023. Trump still set to talk at Bitcoin Nashville. ETH ETF approval this week: Geraci. XRP vs SEC press conference rumoured on 18th. Crypto funds saw $1.44B inflows last week. Rumours China is to ‘unban BTC’ in Q4. S. Korea may delay crypto taxes until 2028. Russia to allow crypto trading on stock exchange. All altcoin categories outperform BTC over 7d. BitConnect infamous promoter convicted. Scroll becomes 8th L2 with TVL over $1bn. ETHFI Season 2 claims available this week. Base hits record 1m UserOps in a week.

entry.title: Zoltan Istvan on AI and Human Immortality
entry.summary: Transhumanist Party founder Zoltan Istvan chats with Decrypt's Emerging Technology report Jason Nelson about his journey with transhumanism, running for office, and why he fears AI is outpacing life science and poses a threat to the quest for immortality.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 157 - ROLLBIT FRIDAY!
entry.summary: The German state sells $2bn+ BTC and has under $300m left. BTC ETF sees $800M of inflows, Mr 100 keeps buying. SOL ETF deadline set for 2025, election could be key. SOL stablecoin TVL soars on Tether & PYUSD growth. Firedancer sees the first accepted block on SOL testnet. ETH ETFs finally expected next week. Monthly active crypto addresses top 100m. Trump to speak at Bitcoin Nashville conference. Golman Sachs to launch 3 tokenization projects. Short squeeze in altcoins sees TIA rise 80% from lows. MOG leads top memes coins, BONK flips WIF. Farming interest shifts to Berachain & Monad.

entry.title: What's the Meta? Meet the Solana Dev Who Suffered Third Degree Burns to Pump a Token
entry.summary:
Meet Mikol: the Dare dev that doused himself in isopropyl alcohol and had fireworks shot at him. He instantly went up in flames and was rushed to hospital, where it became apparent he suffered third degree burns.
In this episode, Mikol reflects on the biggest night of his life, details his injuries, and the grueling recovery process he’s still in. Despite the traumatic incident, Mikol isn’t done with the project. Instead, he’s planning to build a decentralized app where community members can take on dares in exchange for DARE tokens.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 156 - ETH ON THE RISE!
entry.summary: BTC ETF Flows: +$147m. ETH outperforms with ETF optimism. Germany government moves 2375 BTC again. Tether mints another $250m USDT on SOL. Trump to speak at Bitcoin Nashville. Goldman Sachs to launch 3 tokenisation projects. Realised losses similar to COVID period. Staked ETH nears ATH. CEX stablecoin volume hits 7-month low. CFTC says 70-80% of crypto not securities. Base hardfork improves compression 20-30%. BitMEX pleads guilty to AML violation. APTOS & SEI see weak attendance at ETHcc event.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 155 - ETFs SAVE THE DAY
entry.summary: BTC ETF Flows: $216m. $654m of inflows into ETFs over 3 days. BTC transaction fees hit 4-year low. German state moves $300m BTC, holdings $1bn. SOL flips ETH for 7d DEX volumes. SOL Firedancer sees first accepted block on testnet. Tether mints another $250m USDT on SOL. Crypto monthly active addresses tops 100m. Biden crypto veto now expected to be upheld. Tech coalition urges Biden to back crypto. People face security threats at ETHCC. DBS sees 300% growth in crypto trading. PYUSD now 7th largest stable coin. China may have already sold BTC holdings. Elliptic exposes $11bn USDT scam network. StanChart in talks to buy Howard’s crypto fund. Polychain accuses former employee of side deals. SEI leads altcoins as it launches v2 mainnet beta. TIA rises 80% from lows on short squeeze. TON to release L2 based on Polygon’s tech stack.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 154 - THE CELEBS ARE BACK...
entry.summary: BTC ETF Flows: +$295m. ETF inflows fight German selling, BTC unchanged. German government sells $900m BTC, moves more. Rate of sales implies German supply sold this week. ETH ETFs set to launch next week. Election may affect SOL ETF decision March 2025. Raydium beats ETH for 24hr fees. BTC ‘power law’ points to 300% gain by 2025. BTC in 80 day post-halving re-accumulation phase. BlackRock treasury fund hits $500m. Republicans release pro-crypto policy. Senate urges blockchain tests for national security. Drop in BTC mining difficulty ‘comparable to FTX’. MetaMask introduces delegation toolkit. 25 major projects to launch tokens in H2 2025.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 153 - A WEAK WEEKEND
entry.summary: BTC sinks 5% then bounces back to unchanged. $58-60k the main area for ‘shorts to defend’. Crypto funds saw $441m inflows last week. German government transfers 1000 BTC to sell. Crypto sentiment at lowest in over a year. ETH spot premium hits local highs. Japanese firm Metaplanet buys $2.5m BTC. Expect more miners merging: TeraWulf CEO. SOL Firedancer bug bounty goes live. GLM transfers $117m of ETH treasury to exchanges. 98% of coins have topped this cycle: Kang. ETH ETF should come in next 2 weeks: Geraci. Crypto progress disheartening: Copeland.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 152 - JOINED BY DEEZE!
entry.summary: BTC hits $54k, set for worst week in over year. Mt. Gox begins to move BTC & make distributions. German government continues to sell holdings. Worst day for BTC liquidations since FTX. Justin Sun says he is willing to buy German BTC. German MP calls on it to stop selling BTC. $52k super-trend support line eyed for BTC. Funding rates turn extremely negative across majors. Only 6 mining machines profitable below $56k. Coinbase spot buyers emerge to counter drop. Total3 hits RSI lows only hit 4 times in last 4 years. Fear & Greed index hits lowest since Jan 2023. Capo remains bullish. Real selling begins at $38k: Schiff. Coinbase continue to fight for Gensler’s emails. Circle mints $250m USDC on SOL. Symbiotic hits $1bn TVL. Taiwan Mobile may open crypto exchange. Unisat completes funding round with Binance.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 151 - BTC TAPS THE 60K LINE
entry.summary: BTC ETF Flows: -$14m. BTC drops to $60k, CME gap filed again. $1bn shorts liquidated if we rally to $62.6k. Pump(.)fun surpasses ETH for revenue. ETH will outperform BTC after ETF launch: K33. ETH ETF may be delayed even further. BTC heading to $150k: Fundstrat. Chainlink & Fidelity partner for fund data on-chain. USDC protects the dollar: Circle ad. Robinhood considers crypto futures in US & EU. Another BTC miner looks to IPO in US. Vitalik bullish on prediction markets. Sentient Labs raises $85m for AI on SOL. Mantra to tokenise $500m of real estate. TAO falls 15% after security breach. Crypto scams & hacks hit $572m in Q2.
